Articles.Content:
I have confirmed information on steerable landing gear, a science lab, tweakables and many other amazing new features.

Here's all the Squad confirmed stuff: Link

I also have new information which I have no clue if its true or not.

- Sabre engines? - CONFIRMED

- Parts costing money - most likely not true

- New Planet?!? - most likely not true

What else have you guys heard that you aren't sure are real?

Edited December 10, 2013 by Avera9eJoe
Update

I have confirmed information on steerable landing gear, a science lab, tweakables and many other amazing new features.

I also have new information which I have no clue if its true or not.

- Sabre engines? - is this true? Whats your opinion of overpowered or not?

- New Planet?!? - I've heard there's a new planet featured in .23 but is this true?

Unless this is a credible source, I would wait for more official statements .

SABRE-style engines were confirmed a while back during a Twitch broadcast. As for a new planet, I imagine any information confirming or denying that would be kept very hush-hush until the actual release. Gotta have some surprises.
SABRE style engines will probably be placed on the ULTRA high tiers, I mean, look at how high the aerospike engine was placed

I suspect that the hybrid air-breathing/oxidizer engines will either be in the highest aerodynamics sub-branch, or be on a whole new branch of their own that splits out from the highest-tier rocketry and highest-tier aerodynamic nodes.
I believe all of those have been confirmed, expect a new planet.

Sabers have been confirmed.

Only semblance of confirmation I have ever seen on a new planet was forumers saying things like "I bet we get a new planet like we did with Eeloo last year" which amounts to nothing but will lead to rabid foaming at the mouth mobs wielding pitch forks swearing up and down that it was promised if there isn't one anyway.

Mixmaps said on the podcast that the news would be planet sized, not that there would be a new planet, which is something he said would *not* be happening. Did anyone else notice he was talking about parts costing money a lot of times...
Sabre is true. I think it was said that planets, asteroid fields etc. will only be added after tweaking RAM usage and maybe even changing to a newer version of Unity (or something like these).
The SABRE engine will be like a duck: it can fly, can swim and can walk, but it won't be specially good at anything.
Do you want answers?

Do you want answers?

I want the truth!

I want the truth!

You can't handle the truth!
Son, we live in a country with walls...

You can't handle the truth!

The Truth is out there.
http://de.twitch.tv/ksptv/b/485462092

The surprise is that Mu supposedly "Fixed" the water lag bug. Apparently Squad finally managed to get it to render without recalculating physics frames every tick. If this is actually true unlike what Max has said the past three updates where the lag would be "fixed" then maybe it really is planet sized, because I can't enjoy planes or even looking at the terrain now because of how low of FPS I get.
New planet is not coming, so yeah... also.. SCIENCE fixes

I have heard nothing about a new planet.

Sure, that would be awesome, but with tweakables and all coming around soon, I'm wondering when they'd have the time to code in a new celestial body.

That was the most epic dev/mod reply chain I've ever seen.

OT; as other have said SABREs have been confirmed; no confirmation on a planet though. Just rampant speculation.

And we all know what rampant speculation leads to. That's right, economic recessions!

If memory serves, they also said they were updating to the newest version of unity.

#EDIT: Also, consider the source: Me. Memory serves, except when it doesn't. Take the above with a few grains of salt. And coffee.

The surprise is that Mu supposedly "Fixed" the water lag bug. Apparently Squad finally managed to get it to render without recalculating physics frames every tick. If this is actually true unlike what Max has said the past three updates where the lag would be "fixed" then maybe it really is planet sized, because I can't enjoy planes or even looking at the terrain now because of how low of FPS I get.

Actually, Mu has said that the he was working on a whole optimization branch of the development builds but that time ran out on the testing for them to fold in those updates into the 0.22 release as Max has said they would be doing. Since then, there have been Dev updates that indicate that the optimization branch has been folded back into the main development path and we should see substantial performance increases in many areas.
Also, from one of the twitch streams, science logs and significantly improved performace

Actually, Mu has said that the he was working on a whole optimization branch of the development builds but that time ran out on the testing for them to fold in those updates into the 0.22 release as Max has said they would be doing. Since then, there have been Dev updates that indicate that the optimization branch has been folded back into the main development path and we should see substantial performance increases in many areas.

Huh, I didn't know he had the solution gathering dust and just wasn't put into the game. Maybe Max just needs to learn to not count his chickens before they hatch.

I believe all of those have been confirmed, expect a new planet.

That may be true xD

Sabers have been confirmed.

Only semblance of confirmation I have ever seen on a new planet was forumers saying things like "I bet we get a new planet like we did with Eeloo last year" which amounts to nothing but will lead to rabid foaming at the mouth mobs wielding pitch forks swearing up and down that it was promised if there isn't one anyway.

That may instead be true xD
